Description: Body sherd (mended from six fragments) of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: rosette and lotus bud pattern in added white and added red above band of short vertical strokes between red and white bands; further below, red and white bands above frieze of dot rosettes in red and white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of hound chasing a boar to right (of hound, part of head, neck with collar, shoulder with red dot and one foreleg, reaching out to boar, remaining; of boar part of back and top of head missing; red dots all over body); below on cul, double guilloche pattern between lines.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7.
Curator's comments: Hounds, and particularly boars, do not feature frequently on Simple Animal Style vases. The double guilloche pattern, whilst not common in the Simple Animal Style, is usually seen on chalices with antithetical compositions.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 39, pl. V, no. 3)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (p. 139, no. 748, pl. 92)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. X, no. 8)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 290, no. 887)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1140) (phase 2)
